layer.name: Causality
layer.definition: The relationship between cause and effect; understanding that actions produce consequences and current states result from prior causes.

questions.text: I understand that most of my health outcomes are influenced by my accumulated choices, not just genetics or luck.
I can see that chronic health issues often have lifestyle factors that contributed to them, even if genetics played a role.
I recognize that preventive care and maintenance produce different health outcomes than reactive crisis management.
I understand that my body, soul, and spirit are connected â€” neglect in one area affects the others.
I can see that people who are healthy in their 60s, 70s, and beyond usually made different choices than those who aren't.
